Welcome to the General Discussion forum! We encourage you to use this forum to provide feedback and/or discuss your experiences while playing the Overwatch.Community forums work best when participants treat their fellow posters with respect and courtesy, so we ask that you take the time to read through the forum Code of Conduct and Forum Guidelines before posting.Code of Conduct Forum Guidelines For the latest Overwatch news, click here.For the latest Overwatch patch notes, click here.

Welcome to General Discussion - Please Read!
In addition to the forum Code of Conduct, here are some common courtesy guidelines to follow. While these do technically fall within the bounds of the Code of Conduct, they cover more specific examples of common errors that will lead to thread deletions or posting privileges being revoked.The Overwatch forums are for discussion of topics directly related to Overwatch.The forums here are specifically to discuss the Overwatch beta and related topics. Any topics not related to Overwatch, Battle.net, or Blizzard Entertainment are subject to deletion.Don't post in all CAPS, use a misleading title, and/or excessive punctuation, etc.While everyone wants their posts read, we ask you to refrain from using these types of tactics in order to bring more people to your thread. Let your post stand on its own merit. Threads violating this guideline are subject to removal.Don't use words like "Blizzard," "Blue," or any employee names in a thread topic.Everyone would like Blizzard to read and acknowledge his or her post, and we understand that; however, use of such words in the subject line does not help that come to pass. Please make your thread title relevant to the post subject. Threads violating this guideline are subject to removal.Don't "bump" posts.The act of posting simply to bump a thread either frequently or within short period of time is considered spamming. This also includes bumping very old threads for no reason (called "necro bumping" or "necroing").Petition posts are frowned upon.These are discussion forums, so we ask that you hold discussions. Creating a thread to ask for replies as votes is not a discussion. Threads violating this guideline are subject to removal. Don't post about locked or deleted threads.Posts that are moderated have a reason behind the moderation. It's up to you to read the forum Code of Conduct and these guidelines to determine what you did wrong, learn from your mistake, and attempt to post again without breaking any rules.

[Feedback Thread] Mercy Updates - Nov 16, 2017
Hi everyone, We've seen a heavy influx of conversations revolving around recent hero balance updates, especially those revolving around Mercy. In an effort to consolidate feedback and create a steady location for users to share their impressions or opinions, please use this thread. MercyCaduceus StaffIncreased visual readability of Mercy’s healing and damage boosting beamsResurrectCast time increased from 0 seconds to 1.75 secondsMercy’s movement speed is now reduced by 75% while castingCan now be interrupted when Mercy is knocked back, stunned, or hackedValkyrieWhile active, Resurrect no longer has a cast timeWhile active, casting Resurrect does not reduce Mercy's movement speedDeveloper Comments: We feel that Mercy’s recent rework has been successful, but her Resurrect ability still feels too strong and frustrating to play against. Now that it has a cast time, enemies are more able to counter the ability. However, Resurrect will cast instantly when Valkyrie is active. This should make her feel powerful when she transforms on the battlefield.We appreciate your feedback, as it will assist us and provide insight on improving your Overwatch experience. Thank you.

[Feedback Thread] Mercy Updates - Nov 16, 2017
My thoughts on Mercy's current state.1) The cast time is fine, with room for adjustment.*Respawning vs. Resurrecting has issues.-i.e. your team's mercy resurrecting you or another team mate who is near the end of there respawn cooldown, respawning at "base", and the rez still going off and going on cooldown. (my personal big issue with this)*Possible solution to this-pause respawn timer/prevent it from going out while Mercy is resurrecting target player-reset Mercy's resurrect if target player respawns before resurrect takes effect2) The non-reset to GA when ulting is dandy. No problems have been had (by me at least.)3) The Movement speed reduction seems sorta harsh, and if the patch notes truly didn't mention it then that's a problem, but my experience with it as of this time is neutral.

[Feedback Thread] Mercy Updates - Nov 16, 2017
The -75% movement penalty is completely redundant as Mercy has to stay within 5 meters for about 2 seconds to rez the target anyways.It's needlessly punishing.PLEASE MAKE REZ CANCEL-ABLE!!!If you'd like more feedback or suggestions, check out my post on the PTR forums here:https://us.battle.net/forums/en/overwatch/topic/20759330227#post-9EDIT: Cut down the post.

[Feedback Thread] Mercy Updates - Nov 16, 2017
I'd be more than happy to provide more constructive feedback to you guys if I felt that all the constructive feedback that was given before had any impact at all.At this point many feel that this is where their Mercy feedback goes to be forgotten.This entire rework has been a PR nightmare, and honestly you've done a very poor job of managing it.I get it. Speaking to people and getting backlash for your feedback is hard. Believe me, I'm a doctoral student and I have to get patient feedback all the time. People get passionate and comments can get heated. But it's necessary if you want your community to feel like they matter and have a voice. I feel like right now, communication is extremely poor between the developers and the Mercy community. You've never changed a hero to this degree, so I'd advise you to step up your efforts to reach out to the community.

Hey everyone!I don't want to be doing this but I am beginning to feel that the constant nerfing if beginning to make the game very unenjoyable for me to play. I am a Mercy main with approaching 300 hours on the hero. While I appreciate that a nerf needed to happen.. the movement speed and cast time nerf for the res is something that has completely ruined the character for me.The fact that a mercy has always been a target in games was fine with me, it gave dps a person to focus from the enemy side. The recent nerf to her res has made her such an easy target that whenever you go for a res you are most likely going to die for it. I personally never saw the point in the initial nerf as I was never a hide then res mercy but I can see the point from the broader populous of mercy players. With this nerf I really cannot emphasis enough how much it has put me off the game. While I can and do play other heroes my favourite was mercy. The constant nerfs are causing me to stop playing. Which is a shame as I have played a lot of the game and put money into loot boxes etc. I can no longer sit quietly while my favourite hero is destroyed.

[Feedback Thread] Mercy Updates - Nov 16, 2017
I was playing total mayhem earlier this evening (Mercy is totally broken there btw, but then again so are most characters) and I realized something - in some ways Valkyrie works exactly like I want it to do on live. Now, before anyone says "Bunny just want OP Mercy!", hear me out. What I like is that you initiate your ult and then, because of the lowered cooldowns, you fly in and rez people similar to how she worked right after the rework, only instead of the 10 second cooldown it's 5 seconds. Now, I believe on total mayhem Mercy can rez as many as 5 people during her ult, and that is too many for live obviously. But still, the mode gave me a feeling for how it would feel if she had 3 charges with little to no cooldowns, and it feels great! You feel like you make a difference, that you can clutch and save a bad situation. And rezzing feels good in Valkyrie. What I'm trying to say is that this has strengthen my belief that Valkyrie can be fun, it just needs that extra rez charge, and I think if we gave up the ability outside of ult a lot of people would agree that it's a fair trade. [MEGATHREAD-UNCAPPED] Symmetras place in the game
This is extremely long, but I want to illustrate Symmetras problems and how to fix them, hopefully to enlighten the devs on how to fix her. There's not really a TLDR, but if you want to get the gist of it, skim through the bolded areas.Hi Guys. I’ve been hesitant to post this thread, and instead wanted to wait until after Blizzcon to do so. There’s been a huge surge of concern over Symmetra’s place in the game, so much so that there are 3 Megathreads (all from people in masters, with obvious game sense) on making her more supportive in the general forum, and a reddit thread with 3000+ upvotes. https://us.battle.net/forums/en/overwatch/topic/20759249296?page=1https://us.battle.net/forums/en/overwatch/topic/20758668065?page=1https://us.battle.net/forums/en/overwatch/topic/20759257002?page=1https://us.battle.net/forums/en/overwatch/topic/20759220930?page=1https://www.reddit.com/r/Overwatch/comments/7afy3b/the_change_for_symmetra_we_didnt_know_we_needed/?utm_term=b41127a9-d761-42ca-93eb-d750b12c3337&utm_medium=search&utm_source=reddit&utm_name=Overwatch&utm_content=1After hearing the recent Q&A regarding Symmetra, it’s kind of clear that the developers are somewhat unsure of her place in the game, and so I’m hoping that this thread will concisely summarize her issues as well as give the developers clear knowledge of how to fix her, rather than recategorizing her. Blizzcon Q&A:Any plans to make Symmetra more viable in competitive? Maybe healing abilities?Symmetra doesn't really fit well in the support category, but doesn't fit in defense either. In the future we might need to revist the categories to better accomodate changes with the game.Symmetra doesn't see much play in high competitive, but her recent toolkit change brought some interesting changes that made her more viable.Please, please, developers. It’s obvious you listen to us, otherwise a Talon Healer wouldn’t have been the next hero despite the massive demand for her. The community obviously wants her to be more supportive. Recategorizing her will not fix her fundamental issues when there are currently better, more intuitive options in the game for her niche (junkrat), as well as more supportive options for her niche coming as well (moira).From the Patch concerning her rework:"We wanted to address two main issues with Symmetra. First, on the whole, we felt that she didn’t feel active enough. Second, due to the nature of her Teleporter, she felt weak in certain situations on different maps and game modesTo address the first point, we replaced her more passive Photon Shield ability with a much more active ability: Photon Barrier. Now, Symmetra can help lead the charge on offense or help shut down a big push on defense by actively blocking damage for your team. For the second point, we noticed players would often switch off of Symmetra once they found themselves in a situation where her Teleporter wasn’t as useful. For example, when playing her on defense on an Assault map, players often used her to defend the first capture point, then quickly switched to another hero if that point fell. To help her feel more useful in more situations, we've given her an alternative to her Teleporter. The Shield Generator is just as important for the enemy to deal with, but is useful in more situations. ."This is important to note, as she is the most passive support out of all 5, and she is also the most situational. She is not viable on attack, as the intention of the rework. The first rework failed its intended purpose.You can read through this or skim to the bolded sections. While a lot of people argue that Symmetra is strong within her niche. That is precisely the issue with her. When she was most viable was within her Niche on chokes such as Hanamura, Eichenwalde, and Volksaya defense. There were numerous complaints on how hard chokes were to break through, so developers made several balancing adjustments, both to the maps, and characters who had either abilities or mobility to deal with the chokes. From that point onwards,  new map development gave a lot of alternative pathways and elevation that lessened her Niche's effectiveness and gave numerous easy options for counterplay, not to mention she’s not very viable outside of her niche, either.The point? The newest maps, newest characters, and newest buffs to heroes mean that her original Niche is shrinking, and her viability outside that niche is dismal if not compromising to the team. AKA: She’s not relevant to the current version of the game.The elephant in the room: She is the utility support, however, she is the only support whose utility mechanics are not readily available for use (speed, discord, damage boost) while the other support who has utility on cooldown has two highly active, flexible utility abilities that have a variety of uses that outclass Photon Barrier, and have less counters than her turrets do.  The other issue is that all of these support alternatives not only have better utility in their actual kit (not taking into account ultimates), but all the other support utility is in conjunction to healing. She was designed as a damage mitigating, utility support, that defends the backlines; however, almost all of the support in her kit comes from her ultimate, which makes her the only character who is balanced entirely around the merit of her ultimate- which is one of her design flaws, if this patch from Blizzard is any indication:Game-changing ultimate abilities were coming up a bit too frequently. This change helps keep them in check while still allowing them to be powerful. (universal nerf to ultimate charge)If a character is balanced around an ultimate, then it is likely that their kit is lacking. Symmetra has the lowest ultimate costs in the game, and can keep her ultimate up indefinitely. This should raise concerns as to what part of her kit makes this necessary in her design. They wanted her to more engaging in the rework, with more of a capacity for proactive and reactive engagement, but her kit has most of the most passive abilities in the game. Also important to note, if all of her her supportive merit is funneled into her destructible ultimates, she will always lose to Zen/Lucio, who don’t need their ultimate or to keep a structure alive to be supportive. Not only that, but her supportive capacity was originally her E, which rightly means that her original design did not involve a passive ultimate to provide support.Please, complete her kit. We know this is something you’re capable of doing. Within the last month, you completed Mercy’s kit due to the feedback of DPS mains. This is feedback from the people who play the character. Please fix her.She doesn’t  NEED  to heal, but she suffers from an incomplete kit as a support character. (if you need proof she's a support) Luminums videos show her potential as a support, but watching his videos often makes it clear to me that her kit is just not as cohesive as the other characters in the game, even the defense characters which skeptics seem to be convinced she is. His best plays are supportive plays, so she obviously has potential as a support. She just plays more like an offensive support, similar to Zen.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y1GvmBQk8-shttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=flWwBFCTjsUhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cBbe7ylCy18(this was patched but shows how he needs high game sense, and to be innovative to a crazy level to succeed with her limited kit) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6sJwuH1BMwY(this video shows the potential of team flanks at 4:10) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-YhsywtY2OM(and this video shows why symmetra falls short as a support… she needs her team to support her for her to support them. She’s more follow-through dependent than any other support because she lacks support in her actual kit, but people will troll you because they see you as a “troll pick”) He makes great plays, saving his team from reinhardt ultimates, making team flanks, etc. But really, while that’s amazing, there’s not much he can do inbetween that except try to make picks. While other offsupports like lucio/zen, have their utility up (speed/discord) in addition to no cooldown, no ultimate options for heals (heal aura/harmony orb).Quality of Life adjustments for Symmetra are necessary, but if that is all she receives, she likely won't have a place in the game as the game evolves.The best, and most commonly suggested Quality of Life suggestions are:Turrets: Reduce the delay in placing and "activating" the turrets after you deploy them, as well as remove the slow that Symmetra is afflicted with when placing them.Ultimates: Let them be seen through walls for teammates, as well as willful deconstruction of her barrier generator so a skilled Symmetra can change her nesting location, similarly to how a widowmaker will change her sniping location. Let her deconstruct her teleporter to redeem some of her ult charge if the charges are running low. Also, allow her to build her ultimates on walls and ceilings at slightly longer range, so her setups become less predictable.(via AConstelle) Remove the 5-6 second delay she has on gaining ult when her Shield Generator is destroyed. The delay isn't there for TP, but it is for Shield Gen for some reason, and 6 seconds is a lot of time for Sym. Also the blue line indicating the Shield Gen's radius would be swell.Photon Barrier: There have been numerous suggestions for this ability. Increase the charges on it, decrease the cooldown, give her more control over it. The biggest consistent complaint I've seen with this ability is the fact that Symmetra has a harder time contributing with this support utility than other supports have contributing with their utility that is often on a lower cooldown or does not have a cooldown while simultaneously being easier skills to contribute with. This ability needs to be able to compete with an offhealing slot, period. It’s her only active support ability. The other point I want to bring up is that she is the only support who has a viable alternative to rez, which a lot of people are concerned about.[Moderator edit - I removed the direct call-out to the Dev team.  The Feedback here is greatly appreciated but the idea of the forums is a discussion among players.  The Dev team has access to the discussion and may take part in the discussion but the main focus is the discussion.  Not shutting this down just trying to redirect the focus :) ]

[MEGATHREAD-UNCAPPED] Symmetras place in the game
(reserving this post to edit in other suggestions from the community, not the point of this thread, but here to voice any suggestions)FIRST OFF: I want to caution that reworking ideas are not the point behind this thread. More than anything it's to shed light on the issues that Symmetra is facing and how she's becoming obsolete with the evolving nature of the game. These ideas are the kind of ideas Symmetra players wonder about when they think of "viability" in the sense that other characters have that fall under the category of support, without boxing her into something as arbitrary as a healer. I've tried to limit the amount of "reworking" suggestions in this thread, but at this point, I'm leaning more towards it due to her place in the evolving nature of the game and competitive team comps. Moira vs Winston (who dies first... warning, math inside)
Just did the calculations... (feel free to correct me if I forgot to account for something)Basic stats:Winston's tesla cannon does 60 damage per second, 100 rounds (20 per second), reload time of 1.5 seconds (every 5 seconds if you fire non-stop). Range of 8m.Winston has 400 health and 100 armorMoira's Biotic grasp does 50 damage per second, but it heals Moira for 33 damage per second. She has infinite ammo (so no reload time). Range of 21mMoira has 200 healthFormula on how long it will take for Winston to kill Moira:WinstonDmg * (time - WinstonReloadTime) - MoiraHeals * time = 20060*time - 60*1.5 - 33*time = 20027*time - 90 =200time = 290/27 = 10.74 seconds for Winston to kill MoiraFormula on how long it will take for Moira to kill Winston:MoiraDmg * time = 400+10050*time = 500time = 500/50 = 10 seconds for Moira to kill WinstonNote that this is without Moira using any of her orbs. Also note that Winston has to be within 8 meters to deal damage while Moira can evade up to 21 meters and still do damage. Winston could use his shield, but it's not super effective if he has to stay within 8 meters to do damage as Moira would probably be inside of the shield at that stage.Moira wrecks Winston according to the math.

Moira vs Winston (who dies first... warning, math inside)
They're both very mobile though, with their engage and disengage on a 6 second cooldown.  Their priorities are also different, as Winston's job includes killing Moira while hers includes stopping to heal allies.Sure, she could kill Winston slightly faster than he can kill her, but then she's neglecting her duties to her team!  The disparity isn't even that big either.Another support that can also barely kill Winston is Sym, but he has ways to deal with her.

Moira vs Winston (who dies first... warning, math inside)
I wouldn't call taking 10 seconds of constant firing wrecking someone, for starters. Second, her damage ticks multiple times per second, typically this means several small hits, which will individually be reduced by armour, so his starting armour likely increases his survival time dramatically even though it's only 100. It's also worth noting that winston's barrier, while it does not block her orb, DOES block her grasp and prevents it from healing her. At maximum the orb can deal 200 damage to him in perfect conditions, which is unlikely to happen.The real takeaway is that both damages the other so slowly that they can just choose to leave, which isn't surprising, as they're the two lowest DPS heroes in the entire game with decent survival mechanics. Don't forget though that Winston doesn't need to kill a hero to be disruptive, if Moira needs to take time away from healing and gathering heals appropriately for her team then the damage is already done.

what your overwatch class says about you
I feel like the main difference between offense and defense players is not one of playstyle, but of personality.  I actually think that most of the offense and defense characters fall solidly under the role of DPS, and are pretty interchangeable in most situations.  What separates them is the appeal of the characters themselves.  The defense characters are weirder in both the design of their gameplay loop and their aesthetics.  They are more niche.  When you look at the offense heroes, they seem more iconic, and recognizable.  The assault rifle character who has a sprint and regenerating health like in CoD.  The revolver-using cowboy, the snappy spitfire with akimbo pistols.  Then you look at the defense characters and it's like...what?  The autistic girl who attacks you with hard-light projections and an insta-lock energy beam?  The semi-sentient robot who spends have the game stationery?  The archery "sniper" who is more effective in your face than from far-range.  These characters are weird and niche, in comparison to the offense characters who are more standard and viable in every situation.As a result, people who main offense characters typically want to reenact some character they enjoy from popular media, or enjoy playing a character that feels similar to others they've played before.  Defense players typically want to play something weird or rare, and want to play a character who you typically won't see in your average shooter.

I feel like the main difference between offense and defense players is not one of playstyle, but of personality.  I actually think that most of the offense and defense characters fall solidly under the role of DPS, and are pretty interchangeable in most situations.  What separates them is the appeal of the characters themselves.  The defense characters are weirder in both the design of their gameplay loop and their aesthetics.  They are more niche.  When you look at the offense heroes, they seem more iconic, and recognizable.  The assault rifle character who has a sprint and regenerating health like in CoD.  The revolver-using cowboy, the snappy spitfire with akimbo pistols.  Then you look at the defense characters and it's like...what?  The autistic girl who attacks you with hard-light projections and an insta-lock energy beam?  The semi-sentient robot who spends have the game stationery?  The archery "sniper" who is more effective in your face than from far-range.  These characters are weird and niche, in comparison to the offense characters who are more standard and viable in every situation.As a result, people who main offense characters typically want to reenact some character they enjoy from popular media, or enjoy playing a character that feels similar to others they've played before.  Defense players typically want to play something weird or rare, and want to play a character who you typically won't see in your average shooter.

PTR Nerfed Moira Discussion
I've just come off from playing a few games (as and against Moira) on the PTR, and before anyone jumps at me with "a few games isn't enough", considering what they changed you don't need to playtest much to get a feel for it.To clarify for those who don't know (though I'm sure most of you do), Moira's right click damage beam's hitbox has been nerfed so you have to be much more accurate now to be effective. As for mere stats, I've gone from having a 70-80% accuracy on live to maybe 50% on PTR.Problem is this seemingly small nerf hits like a truck through the butterfly effect...1. Harder to hit damage beam means less overall damage2. Less overall damage means less overall healing charge3. Less healing charge means less healing / ability to heal4. Less healing & less damage means less ult charge5. Less ult charge means fewer ults6. Fewer ults means even less healing and damageand...2.5 Less overall damage means less self healing3.5 Less self healing means you're more prone to damage4.5 More prone to damage means being dead / out of the fight more5.5 Either scenario means you are are healing or damaging people much lessUpon release she was almost perfectly balanced. Only two things seemed to stand out as perhaps a tiny bit powerful... 1. She's very survivable2. She gets her ult pretty quickly...which I can assume is what caused the nerf in the first place. While the nerf DOES handle both of these things, it does in too extreme a manner.Survivability was probably the bigger issue of the lot, but there are several ways that could have been solved. Reduce the vampirism healing from her right click from 33 to 20/25 per second, or increase the cooldown on Fade by a second or two. We were finally given a good soft counter to Tracer and Genji(and to a lesser extent Pharah) and yet they nerfed the one thing that makes killing them infinitely harder.  At this point I can't help thinking the flanking dps are blizzard's pet favourites and that's why they're always so powerful and have so little that can be done against them, but maybe that's overthinking it.I can only hope that this doesn't go through to the live servers, I don't want her stuck in the same bottomless pit that Doomfist has been basically since his hitbox nerf. I would love for them to try out returning her hitbox and then trying any of the suggestions mentioned prior BEFORE they put her into live.Edit: I forgot to include she can't do any damage to barriers at the moment... I can only assume that's a bugWhat does everyone else think of her?

If loot boxes are gambling, what about
Trading cards etc. are physical items that will always have some trade-in value close to if not in excess of the price you paid for the pack. It is typically quite hard to sink large amounts of money into physical collectables and be completely unable to recoup it. Reselling (or even official selling) also allows people to purchase individual items they want, which reduces the incentive to gamble on the outcome.People get hung up on the semantics of "are lootboxes gambling" a lot. Obviously they are not the exact same thing as gambling in a casino, which is why they haven't fallen under the umbrella of current gambling laws. It is very clear that loot boxes do use the same tactics of psychological manipulation to prey upon compulsive behaviour, however. This leaves them in a very shady grey area that clearly needs new and/or adapted legislation to cover it, otherwise publishers are going to continue doing what they've been doing until a story hits the mainstream news about some kid developing a gambling addiction and bankrupting their parents thanks to unregulated lootbox systems in video games.

Pros: You recycle your Orisa shield very well, this is good, you are providing continual protection for your team.Your positioning is good defensively for both pointsCons: You could get a lot more out of Orisa if you aim for the head. Her headshots are where she really shines. Piggy backing off the headshots, a great tactic is to use the orb then aim where the person you pull is going to end up after pulled and spam that location for good hits. Also aiming the orb higher allows for more shots and holds the enemy slightly longer because now they have to fall further. You may think this is a small thing, but it can mean the difference between a kill or an enemy getting away.Watch your flank and watch to see if your team is relocating their position, there were a few times when flankers were making their move to the right or left, and your team wanted to engage them. Follow them in and give them your shield. Once you mop up, then place your shield in it's normal defensive position for the next attack.There was one time when the enemy mei blocked your vision on the second point. If you see this, chances are they are trying to hide their flank, and sure enough, the enemy team went right and it caught you off guard.Lastly, and this point is very important: You need to tab key (not sure what button this is for the consoles). You need to see the enemy hero composition to know if you should switch to a better tank for the situation. Not only this, tabbing will also allow you to see your teams ultimates to know if you can combo, or that you may need to drop your ult if it's the only one ready for the next enemy attack.This last point is the best advice I can give you to improving your game. While on attack:Cons:starting with cons because I notice them right away. You are straddling the choke. You don't want to do this. You need to be pushing up with your team. Symmetra is holding down the left, so right side is a good choice. The enemy Orisa and Bastion are on the high ground (they have better positioning) your best bet is to have the lucio speed boost your team to the right and claim the higher ground to then attack the point. You spend minutes fighting a symmetra you can't kill on the right. Not good, your shield gets demolished in seconds vs the enemy bastion. Again, there is no point in straddling the choke. You are just watching your squishes die at the choke, instead of taking space (like a tank should do) to help your dps move into better positions to secure kills.@13:13 you finally push in, but this should have been done immediately, or with several attempts till your team breaks through.@14:50 you placed your shield on the choke, instead of placing it further up to help your 76 engage the enemy. Remember, again, tanks take space to help their team push in or secure kills. Place your shield further up to provide your team better protection, all your squishes are out in front of your shield, and that's not their fault, you have to have better shield placement on attack.@15:00 again, your put your shield on the bridge choking your group, instead of throwing it on the point to start to take space and engage the point with your team. This resulted in 2 squishes getting killed because they wanted to push onto the point, but your shield was further back.@15:40 you straddle the choke again. @16:04 two teammates are dead and you pop your ult. Not the best time to do it. Also your team is divided, would be better if they were all grouped up. You are the shield tank, your team is best when rallying with you. @16:40 I'm noticing you don't notice when your team is being flanked/killed via the kill feed in the top right. Tunnel vision can be a very bad thing in this game. Looking at the enemy team comp @18:03 Orisa may not be the best choice. The enemy reaper is building ult fast from kills. Her shield is becoming more useless against junkrat spam and Bastion. I personally would switch to D.Va at this point to attempt to stop a reaper ult, have the ability to fly away with d.va in case of rip tire, and DM bastion for pushing power. Not only that, your teammate went winston, not a very good pick in this situation, a Zarya would be better, but you could at least dive with Winston with D.Va. Also, you already have a lucio to help quickly push in.@18:26 NO! Your team got 3 picks and your shield placement was NOT on the point! You need better shield placement on attack with Orisa. You placed your shield and then ran past it, providing no protection to anyone. @20:25 You placed your shield behind your team. Not good. If you see your team push up, follow them. You must react to your team with your shield placement, don't rely on them to react to you. If you would have pushed up with your team, you would have avoided the flanking pharah. Not sure if you noticed, but the reason why you got smashed that round was because the enemy team ran dive, and that counters Orisa hard. @24:00 you will notice on this attack, you are in the back, you aren't fully aware of your own teams position. This isn't good. You need to be leading the charge. You need more spacial awareness if you want to play Orisa on attack - and that includes being aware of your team, and when they decide to push. Enemy team over extended bad at the end. Victory! I hope this helps. It's some of the things I noticed.The big stuff:-More spacial awareness-More awareness of your team-Don't straddle the choke. PUSH!-TAB to see enemy team comp and to be aware of your teams ult economy/comboingYou are much better on defense than offense  with Orisa, but that's only because you need to improve your shield placement on attack. You need to shield not just yourself on attack, but also your team, or further up to create more space. Hope this helps.

Widowmaker and the power creep
Widowmaker has been the first character along with McCree to receive massive nerfs, that made her unplayable for many months, and finally she got buffed to a point where she would have been a decent mid-tier pick back then.Except the game moved on, the dive characters who were always strong didn't get nerfed, while everyone else got mostly buffs, and as such over time Widow ended up countering less and less characters, while new characters have been introduced that counter her. Now she feels really weak again, like even the changes in the last patch she got buffed in made her a less useful character overall... Widow has a really low dps, her headshots are strong, but nothing else.A long ago Torbjörn got a buff, where he can hammer faster, and as such it takes forever for Widow to destroy a turret if it's being hammered.Bastion can heal more too.The healing output of healers increased: Lucio heals more, Ana and Moira have been introduced, who heal a lot, Mercy got a new ultimate that now does AOE healing.The amount of shields also increased.Winston can drop bubbles more often, and you don't have enough dps to break it before it disappears on it's own.Symmetra got reworked and got a shield, that's pretty annoying.And then Orisa got released... Originally she was pretty vulnerable to Widow, but then she got buffed, and now she has 100% shield uptime that Widow also can't break.DM got nerfed, but then now DVa can just ram you down, and kill you really quickly, offsetting that tenfold.And then Roadhog.He is a character whose damage got nerfed a lot, but Widow has such an unfortunate hitbox Roadhog can one shot her consistently, so that didn't really affect her.Then there is the E buff, that allows Roadhog to soak up multiple headshots, and get away from Widow. Like on average if you can 1v1 a hog it takes 4 headshots and a body shot.The overall mobility of characters also increased. Hanzo got buffed to the point where she is basically a racecar compared to Widow, you basically can't win a peekaboo war, because he is a lot faster, can jump and shoot, and wall climb and shoot, while you are stuck standing almost still.Sombra is a new character who is really hard to hit, with many mobility options, as killing you from stealth.Doomfist is also a mobile character, who can sometimes survive a headshot too, and all of his abilities disposition you, ruining your aim.And now Moira can dive you too if you dare to stand on the ground. And even if she has no cooldowns, smg does so little damage, she just outheals you.And even Junkrat got a buff, that allows him to dive you and burst you down with the second mine, before you even scope in.And spamming is now really strong in this game.Maps are really small, and are full of cover, while Widow is super squishy with no self sustain. There are times where I can't even fire a shot because I'm low before I scoped in...Junkrat got very strong.Orisa can fire almost constantly.And now Moira. Her orbs can poke you down wherever you are, taking down a large part of your HP and perpetually zoning you off without a pocket healer.And the Mercy rework:You never really wiped teams, she negates your picks without investing much, and if you get a pick in the back line that's probably safe to resurrect even with the cast time and slow. Basically you have to dodge a lot more, and during that time you can't fire, there are lot more shields to block your shots, your body shots are healed up really fast, and people have lot more tools to kill you, including healers.She is the hardest hero in the game, and she isn't rewarding enough, people achieve the same results with much less effort, only your headshots matter, only on squishy characters, and only if Mercy can't rez that.I don't know what to do about it, but she definitely needs some help.

Can bastion be granted some independance?
As  a bastion player, I really have fun playing this character, But theres a very huge issue ive noticed, The fact that he has 0 capability to defeat most of his counters on his own, Let me explain, Imagine the current situation:  your playing bastion in the high ground, (This is a 1v1 situation, none of the characters get help) and so, a genji dashes on you, already taking a few hp off you and starts jumping arround you spamming right click, Now this is probably the only chance bastion would have on winning, on killing the genji on that exact moment as he´s beeing attacked, But this is not what i want to point out so lets imagine that the bastion isnt able to kill genji,  If genji got low, He can easily dash away escaping in any point of the battle if he wished so, Generally how this fight personally goes for me is like this: I de-setup going into recon mode and attempting to escape the battle by jumping off the ledge and trying to heal, How this always goes for me is that the enemy genji in this case chases me, still spamming right click, He´s jumping everywhere giving me a really hard time hitting him (im not god-like master aim) but in case of the genji, even if his aim was MEDIOCRE he will still land most of his shurikens because i have the hitbox of roadhog, Without his hp, In this types of matchups bastion generally never wins, He gets hard countered like this with many characters, prime examples of this are Reaper , Tracer, Genji, Etc, Because once they got near you, you have a very small window of the initial fight where either you kill them, Or theres no point in fighting anymore because your dead, Bastion lacks independance, and yeah, i understand some characters might be a little bit more reliant on the team than others, But there should be a point where a player can, With a little bit more skill than which i have, fight off their counters but with bastion, you just feel helpless that you either are able to jump and setup on top of a health pack to save yourself, or your just dead exept you have aimbot,  So i thought of a small idea..feel free to disagree, maybe i just need to get better aim to properly fight off some counters but anyways: What if bastion got an E abilityE ability:BarrierOn pressing E, Bastion activates a small barrier in front of him, Bastion is unable to shoot while this barrier is active The barrier has 200 hp (can be less if you want to) The point of this barrier is properly beeing able to survive attacks from characters like Reaper, Genji, Tracer, Widow, Hanzo, Etc. Imagine the following situation,Your in turret mode, shooting at an X target, In which, you see your hp deplete quickly from a reaper that is coming your way, So, In order to survive you Press E, to summon your barrier to protect you as you hold right click to heal the 200 you lost from reapers sneak attack, Reaper wasted all his shots on your barrier and so he now needs to reload, And this is your oportunity to strike and barrage him with your large minigun.Anyways This is just an idea i had from my own experience playing bastion

LatAm players quitting the game due to server problems
So it seems that the new latin american server, SAC1, located in Chile, it's not being developed anymore as we tested in the PTR, so we're playing in the brazilian server. The free weekend was a nightmare, every game had between 200 and 700ms of ping. But the worst part was... disconnections. According to some players in Argentina who created a thread in the spanish (LA), they've got disconnected from the server mid games between 5 and 20 times. I've played with some brazilian people and they told me that they have experienced the same problem. Other players from other south american countriea had the 200-700ms + disconnections after the last patch. A few CMs from the forum told us that Blizzard's net engineers are investigating this issue, but they also said that we should avoid playing the game (especially competitive). Despite that many of us don't play competitive, we have a lot of players who are in high ranks (diamond and higher) and reported to have lost between 300 and 500 SR due to disconmections, and what's more, the devs and MVPs told them not to play competitive for a while... but their SR decays for inactivity too!What was most surprising, is that some of us tried to connect to the NA and EU servers and we had LESS PING!It's been a year since Blizzard promised to fix the brazilian server and separate it from a new server in Chile. Latin american players has choosen Chile as the place to develop the server because it has a great routing (and many videogame companies placed their server there). Brazil doesn't have a good route, but many videogame companies added a server at Brazil so their players can group and play together without worrying about ping. There's also a language barrier that destroys the harmony of the matches, sometimes we don't understand portuguese and sometimes they don't understand spanish, resulting a confussion between teams. It's not common to find that all of the teammates can communicate in english in the voice chat.Latin American server is almost dead. Lag spikes, disconnections and constant high latency are ruining our games. When they've confirmed the developememt of the SAC1 server, we saw a light of hope, but it's gone.Due to this issues, players are getting banned for literally NO REASON. Yet we know that we shouldn't play comp when the server is saturated, but inacticity also results in SR decays. And almost all of quick play players (I'm one of them) are getting the -75% EXP ban. Brazilian players, even if its the place where the server is located, are having the same trouble too. SOME LATAM PLAYERS ARE QUITTING THE GAME. They feel that this is not funny anymore.Blizzard, we need your help urgently. Save the servers.Save LatAm players.SAVE OVERWATCH!And LatAm players promise to support AUS players who are having server problems too. Let's raise up our flags! Thank you.

What does crouching do?
Serious question, when you press Ctrl, some characters crouch. What does this do? Does it make your hitbox smaller? Why can some characters crouch but others can't? What's the general point?I'm sorry if this sounds silly, I'm genuinely curious.

What does crouching do?
It makes your footsteps quieter.

What does crouching do?
Crouching makes you slower, but your overall hitbox size decreases and your footsteps become significantly quieter. It's good to crouch-walk when you're sneaking up on enemies (especially if you're someone like Reaper who has army-equipped basketballs for feet apparently), and it's good to spam crouch when trying to avoid getting headshot.I think D.va is the only one that can't crouch, while in meka. Not... entirely sure why.

What does crouching do?
Believe it lowers footstep noise as well as shrink your overall hit box and allow you to take advantage of certain covers.11/21/2017 05:30 PMPosted by HeavyI think D.va is the only one that can't crouch, while in meka. What does crouching do?
Quiet footsteps, so you can sneak up on peopleSmaller hitbox, so if you're playing long-range, you're harder to hitCover-based tactics, like hiding behind a short box or behind the edge of a balcony from above, and using your crouching to peek in and out

Can I Please Have Some Reinhardt Tips
1: Don't let your shield break. Leave it at ~50 health instead of letting it die. It can save some lives.2: Try baiting abilities/enemy shatter by putting your shield down for a second and pretending to swing. It can save you from a flashbang/scatter, sometimes even a Pulsebomb. 3: Be really careful with your charges. Only do it if you know it's not suicide. Try using it to clean up a teamfight you're winning, or to protect your teammate, usually a healer, when someone's diving them.4: Don't be afraid to use your hammer. It does 75 damage per swing. 2 swings at the enemy DPS can give your team a huge advantage, and it grants you a lot of ult charge.5: Don't go alone. Your shield will fall faster than Hanzo main's SR if you try to go 1v4-6.You need your team behind it.6: Try mastering your predictions so that you can use Firestrike consistently.7: Don't be afraid to shatter. Getting a huge one is great, but killing 2 people is usually enough to swing the battle to your side. You'll build another one really quickly anyway.8: Don't be passive/defensive when pushing a choke. Walk forwards with your shield up if your team is with you. Make space for the DPS. Standing and waiting for a miracle won't really help much.9: Know how to position yourself, so you can shield your teammate when he's slept, frozen getting shot at too much, and so that you yourself won't die that easily because you were out of position.10: Don't stand on the payload with the shield up when versing another Rein.His shatter will go under your barrier if it's not touching the ground.That's all I can think of now, I might update the list if something comes to my mind.Hope you'll find that at least somewhat helpful.Oh, another one, when fighting against Junkrat, try having your Firestrike ready as much as you can. Junk's more likely to try and detonate it behind you, so that you don't block it, and the quick flick can save your life.

I'm not sure if it's been said in this thread or not but the reason Mercy's res does not refresh from cooldown after respawning is because that would be absolutely broken for stall tactics. A Theory for Guilds: Those Who Want to Work Together
I am not writing this post for my fellow players. I am writing it, hoping a mod or developer will see it and add a tally to the board in favor of a complete competitive makeover (if such a thing even exists).This is a game ALL about teamwork. Blizzard encourages teamwork and sensible team composition with their mouths, but at the end of the day they’re throwing six random players into a basket and expecting them to form a cohesive and intelligent strategy. I am a member of the small minority that believes most people in this game are actually smart and are capable of winning. In other words, I recognize the humanity in my teammates and opponents and I realize that most of us actually want a present and calm experience. Regardless of what we want, we rarely get it. We are shaken up and tossed into games, and we all just hope the right ingredients are there.Now, in addition to understanding that my fellow players are peoples with hearts capable of feeling pain, joy, and frustration, I also (and this is probably an unpopular belief) think that maining a specific class is bad for the game. I play a little bit of everything because that’s what makes me the best I can be. I have a complete perspective on the heroes. Blizzard wanted this to be a game where everyone plays everything, switches and counters happen frequently, and we all get along. I understand why, but they wanted too much. It’s time to let go of ideas that just aren’t working. Players won’t want to learn every hero or role. Personally, I think flexing would be ideal, but that’s just not the reality we’re in. I’m a writer, and I know how hard it can be to let go of a concept or an idea or a scene that you envisioned at the beginning. But it has to happen to the greater good. (Example: Rolwing, the writer of Harry Potter, has come out and said she wishes she paired Harry and Hermione together in the end because they ended up having better chemistry than Ron and Hermione, but she had originally envisioned the Ron/Hermione marriage, and she went with it and now regrets it, even going so far as to say that Ron and Hermione get counseling in the future!) Things change. Circumstances evolve. Holding on to things that just don't work anymore is unhealthy. Kaplan has said he’s afraid of adding role queue because he doesn’t want to force a meta. It’s being forced either way. A role queue wold help, but I believe the freshest answer to Overwatch’s toxicity would be implementing a guild system.I know I’m far from the first to suggest this, and this post is really just me adding my voice to the coalition of reason and introducing the idea to anyone who is reading and hasn't heard it yet. I played WoW BC–Cat, and (especially in the BC and early Wrath days), being in a guild was super important and super fun. It was nice having that camaraderie, knowing you were invited based on your accomplishments. It was a thrill to receive a message from a guildy because he needs a Hunter for a raid and he saw my gear and wanted to know if I had time to help out. (Imagine being asked to join a game because a guildy knows you’re a sick Mercy or Reinhardt or Widowmaker.) Guild members were nice to one another by necessity, and if someone had a problem with a guild member, they could leave the guild or try to work it out. Either way, minimal toxicity.I enjoy Widowmaker and Sombra the most, and I have a lot of hours on them. But I hardly ever play them in competitive because I know someone is going to think I’m either trash or throwing and are going to then throw themselves or just not take the game as seriously (i.e. the Mercy won’t heal my Widow). As a result, I spent seasons II–VI flexing on heroes I have FAR fewer hours on. I simply am not contributing as much as I could be for fear of my teammates’ backlash. On the other hand, it is frustrating when I pick off a Zen or a Mercy, and my Reinhardt just continues to wobble back and forth at the choke, or when I go for that sick 5–6 EMP, and the team doesn’t make a move to follow up. The root of the toxicity problem in Overwatch is that we don’t trust one another and we don’t have a reason to.Blizzard, I am leaving Overwatch until this issue is addressed. A guild system may be contrary to what you imagined, but I doubt you imagined the level of toxicity this game has reached. There are other real issues this game has such as the nerfs of new heroes and the state of Hanzo, but fixing these will not fix the game. A guild system will certainly not make the game worse. Implement rank-based guilds: Bronze–Silver, Silver–Gold, Gold–Plat, Plat–Diamond (Master and Grandmaster would have to be in their own tiers). Maybe a whole guild could climb out of Silver together, or if one member passes others, wish them luck and begin the hunt for a new guild. I don't know exactly how it would work, but Blizzard has smart employees. I'm sure they can figure it out.This can work and it promotes so much team spirit and positive reinforcement. I really enjoy this game, and I know most people do too and want a positive experience. We all want to work together, but there isn’t a system in place that let’s us.<U+2028><U+2028>(I’m hoping this is already in the works, and if it is I’ll be three for three on Overwatch requests/predictions. I said months and months ago they should make a healer who damages to heal and I hoped they would do Blizzard IP-themed costumes for Halloween. Well, we’ve pretty much got both of these things now! So here’s to hoping a guild system is coming soon!)Thanks to those who read! If you think some form of a guild system would be beneficial for Overwatch, keep the conversation alive! Otherwise, I really hope you all have fun and get along with one other.
